definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Whales use their pectinate teeth to gather plankton.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼用牠们栉齿状的牙齿来捉浮游生物。

sentences.english: So we know this plankton is very dange rous.
sentences.chinese: 可见浮游生物是非常很快死亡。

sentences.english: The cholera bacteria Vibrio cholerae can live on some species of plankton.
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的病原体霍乱弧菌可以在一些浮游生物体内生存。

sentences.english: Many fish depend on this small life-form for food.
sentences.chinese: 许多鱼类以此种小的浮游生物为食物。

sentences.english: Unicellular planktonic groups form the basis of the food chain in the deep sea.
sentences.chinese: 单细胞浮游生物是形成深海食物链的基础。

sentences.english: Haptomonads are common in marine plankton and freshwater.
sentences.chinese: 定鞭藻类通常存在于海洋和淡水浮游生物中。

sentences.english: The dead plankton on the bottom must be preserved from oxidation.
sentences.chinese: 在海底的浮游生物必须被保护起来以免遭氧化作用。

sentences.english: This is phosphorescence of the sea, caused by plankton interacting in the water.
sentences.chinese: 这是海洋磷光，是浮游生物与水相互作用造成的。

sentences.english: When it's dipped into the sea, plankton are trapped between them.
sentences.chinese: 被浸没在海水中以后，浮游生物会被困在网筛之间。

sentences.english: The creatures devourhuge quantities of plankton, thus depriving small fish of the food they need."This
sentences.chinese: 水母吞食大量浮游生物，抢占小鱼小虾的食物来源。

sentences.english: The South Atlantic’s annual bloom regularly measures more than 1, 000 kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 南大西洋每年一次的浮游生物潮常常绵延上千公里。

sentences.english: A sea leopard behind a curtain of plankton.
sentences.chinese: 一只海豹躲在浮游生物的幕面。

definition: water plants/habitat with water source and grass
shallow sea/sea less than 200 meters deep
to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food
